result.execSummary:
The defendant Briana Yvonne Paquette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. 
*If revoked and sentenced to prison. The department to collect funds from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account of reasonable amounts as determined by DOC to be used for payment of obligations. If any fines, costs, surcharges, & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision. If  discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. 
*All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

*Comply with and complete the Portage County Drug Treatment Program and follow all treatment recommendations 
*Comply with all of the rules of probation
*Submit DNA Sample

9:38 AM Defendant Briana Yvonne Paquette in court.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Briana Yvonne Paquette.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are 21CF314, 21CF220 & 22CF130.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
21CF220:
Count 1 - Dismissed
Count 2 - Dismissed
Count 3 - Dismissed and Read In

21CF314:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In
Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In

22CF130:
Count 1 - Guilty 
Count 2 - Dismissed and Read in
Count 3 - Guilty
Count 4 - Dismissed and Read In
Count 5 - Dismissed and Read In

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1 in 22CF130:   Possession of Methamphetamine 961.41(3g)(g) and guilty of Count 3 in 22CF130:  Bail Jumping - Felony 946.49(1)(b).
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
**Dismissed:  Count 1 & 2 of 21CF220
**Dismissed and Read In:  Count 3 of 21CF220 and Count 1 & 2 of 21CF314 and Count 2, 4 & 5 of 22CF130.

ADA Cassidy makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Jakobson makes sentencing arguments to the court. 

BY THE COURT: 
22CF130:
Count 1 -
Impose but STAY a 3 Year Prison Sentence
Initial Confinement:  18 months
4 days of incarceration credit
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Extended Supervision:  18 months
Placed on Probation for a Period of 3 Years -
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with and complete the Portage County Drug Treatment Program and follow all treatment recommendations 
No objection to early discharge from probation, if she successfully completes the Portage County Drug Treatment Program
Comply with all of the rules of probation 
Pay costs

Submit DNA Sample

4 days of incarceration credit
